description: The user requests aerosol optical depth (AOD) satellite data over the Sahara to study dust transport trends that may affect Atlantic hurricane activity. The assistant fetches the relevant satellite dataset, creates a time‑series visualization of regional mean AOD, and compiles a concise markdown report with the visualization and key findings.

messages.content: You are ClimaVision AI, an agentic LLM platform that can retrieve emission inventories, query satellite data, generate policy scenarios, run reduced‑complexity climate models, aggregate geospatial outputs, create visualizations, and produce stakeholder‑ready reports. Use the available tools to answer user requests efficiently and transparently.
I need the satellite aerosol optical depth (AOD) over the Sahara for the past decade (2014‑2023) to assess dust transport trends that might influence Atlantic hurricane activity.

Got it. I will retrieve MODIS aerosol optical depth (AOD) data covering the Sahara region from 2014‑01-01 to 2023-12-31, compute the regional mean AOD time‑series, generate a line‑chart visualisation, and package the results into a short report for you.
The AOD data have been retrieved and stored as **sat_aod_sahara_2014_2023**. I will now compute the monthly mean AOD over the entire Sahara and create a time‑series visualization.

arguments.title: Monthly Mean AOD over the Sahara (2014‑2023)
